pageContext.description: Fragment consisting of shoulders & upper part of blade. Cutting edges of blade chipped & blunt; ricasso notches, one almost completely broken away. Rivet hole in each shoulder, above the rivet was there develop slight flanges to the hilt-piece; mid rib extending the whole length of the fragment. Considerably bent.
pageContext.associations: Part of large hoard; see card for first sword fragment.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Evans,Jessup, Arch. of Kent, 107,Journ. Anthrop. Inst. III, 230
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on line of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, lying on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NE by N of summit of hill. Found June 4, 1872
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
